title: (16400) Tarancón - 9T Plaza del Ayuntamiento
description: Next to the Town Hall and in the old town, ground parking, very quiet for one night! Guarded by the Local Police. Bars and shops very close. I recommend trying the drunks "Bollería Máxima" (very close to the parking lot)

title: (16400) Tarancón - 9D Calle General Emilio Villaescusa
description: Ground parking without services. Next to the Adif station.

title: (16400) Tarancón - 3 Calle Evilasio Martínez Bueno
description: Signposted public parking. Quiet neighborhood with nearby shops and parks. 15 minutes from the center on foot

title: (16400) Tarancón - 118 Avenida Miguel de Cervantes
description: "DO LAUNDRY" A laundromat in the town of Tarancón. Has 2 machines 12 kg and 1 machine 16 kg and 2 dryers. Also has a pet clothes machine and dryer. No internet or toilets. Street parking or park on the dirt lot mapped out on Park4night.

title: (16400) Tarancón - 55 Avenida Progreso
description: Parking of trucks and vans next to the petrol station, paved, with many streetlights at night. Quiet and without traffic noise. Gas station at 20 meters, restaurant and cafeteria at 30 meters and supermarkets at 10 minutes walking. There are no services, ideal for a trip stop between days.

title: (16400) Tarancón - Carril Huete
description: Quiet place if you have to stop and spend the night

title: (16400) Tarancón - 3 Camino Catorce
description: Several parking spaces in line in the urban area of Tarancón next to the Parque de la Juventud. It is not a specific area for motorhomes but it is in a discreet place where you can park and even spend the night without too much trouble.

title: (16400) Tarancón - Unnamed Road
description: Next to the hermitage of Riánsares Located next to the A40 motorway just at the exit from Tarancón towards Cuenca. Plenty of level space between trees and with some shops and a bike path that takes you to the town. A quiet place surrounded by nature with barbecues and a fountain.

title: (16400) Tarancón - N-400
description: Great little spot, we arrived late at night so felt very lonely when we arrived, but woke up to lovely sunrise and felt safe, quite a way out from town

title: (16470) Belinchón - 23 Calle Alfonso VIII
description: The church ground parking lot. We were very quiet because we had houses in front of us. The neighbors did not make a problem but they looked at us something strange. In the town square, you can probably also park.

title: (16400) Tarancón -
description: Private estate ideal for a break, overnight allowed maximum 48 hours, with good access, located about 4 km from Tarancón on the A-40, quiet place. It is currently being improved so that in the future it will have filling and emptying services for deposits, the price will be used to improve the facilities. Please call.

title: (16465) Huelves - 11 Calle Boleo
description: Level enough to spend the night from 7 to 8 vans or motorhomes. In front there are swings for children and also a dumpster. About 200m inside the village there is a park with fountain.

title: (28597) Urbanización Alarilla -
description: At the shell gas station there is a medas restaurant with accessible showers

title: (16452) Uclés - 14 Carretera Rozalen del Monte
description: Large parking area with a view over the valley to the monastery of Ucles. The parking area is not shaded and is on an incline. No services but there are water fountains just down the road on the outskirts of the town and there is black and grey drainage a few minutes drive on the road towards Paredo.

title: (16452) Uclés - 17 Calle Silleria
description: Large esplanade in front of the monastery of Uclés which is worth the detour.

title: (16452) Uclés - Unnamed Road
description: Ucles at the exit of the town very lonely in the middle of the field when you think there is nothing else there is the area with water and drainage. Municipal area. Attached to the cemetery. Past the 2nd graveyard, the first exit to the left and it's behind a gray shed with green beams.

title: (45370) Santa Cruz de la Zarza - 2 Travesía Colón
title_short: (45370) Santa Cruz de la Zarza - 2 Travesía Colón

title: (28597) Fuentidueña de Tajo - Calle Dieciséis

(although in parallel with a roundabout that serves only the village no nuisance strictly no traffic during the night and only the passage of 4 vehicle during the morning)

title: (16555) Carrascosa del Campo - 4 Plaza Alameda

title: (16555) - Unnamed Road

title_short: (16555) Carrascosa del Campo - 19 Avenida de José Antonio

title: (16430) Saelices -

title: (16430) Saelices -
description: An incredible esplanade to sleep and be calm. You sleep next to a ruined castle. There are several trails to walk. EYE! There is no shade. No service pure nature. Access is via a fairly easy dirt road.

title: (45890) Cabezamesada - 3 Calle la Piedad
description: Public water source, in the center of a small town, next to the square. Just load clean water. Do not pour neither gray nor black. Let's respect the environment and the neighbors. Garbage container right next to it and store, bank, pharmacy nearby.

title: (16440) Montalbo - Carretera de Valencia

title: (16421) Puebla de Almenara - Unnamed Road
description: Hermitage of the Virgin of Mercy in Puebla de Almenara. There is a rural house. It has public services (ask them to open). There is drinking water. And parking for vans and caravans (free). You can ask for the key and see the hermitage. From here, hiking and biking routes depart throughout the Jarameña mountain range. Also, you can see the Castle from the 14th century belonging to the order of Santiago with capital in Uclés. Sport, history, nature ... you can't ask for more. Greetings traveler

title: (16421) Puebla de Almenara - Unnamed Road
description: Recreation area "La Ermita", next to the path that goes up to the castle of Puebla de Almenara. There are numerous open fields around which you can park a large motorhome. I don't recommend the road that goes up to the antennas for very large vehicles.

title: (16500) Huete - 71 Carretera de Carrascosa

title: (28380) Colmenar de Oreja - 38B Calle de San Sebastián
title_short: (28380) Colmenar de Oreja - 38B Calle de San Sebastián
description: NEW MOTORHOMES PARKING AREA IN COLMENAR DE OREJA (MADRID) The Colmenar de Oreja City Council enables a new parking space for motorhomes, caravans and campers next to the Jardines de los Huertos and the Hermitage of San Isidro, near the town historical, which will facilitate sightseeing for itinerant travelers. The parking area has: - Shaded wooded area - Children's play area - Picnic area - Drinking water - Capacity 8 vehicles - Free area - Allows overnight (maximum 48h) - Nearby gas station - Supermarkets in the vicinity - Restaurants in the proximity - Wine cellars in the proximity - Next to the historic center of Colmenar de Oreja, declared a Site of Cultural Interest. - Cycling routes (Ciclamadrid Aranjuez-Chinchón and Ciclamadrid Belmonte-Villarejo de Salvanés) - Hiking routes (Vereda del Cristo, Train Route, Fountains Route, Tagus Route) * Does not have: drainage of gray / black water, connection electrical

title: (16160) - 1 Diseminado Diseminados

We can also find containers and a water source. You cannot spend the night since the hermitage closes around 6-7 in the afternoon

title: (19119) Zorita de los Canes - 31 Calle Espolon

A bit noisy from traffic, the Recopolis car park is much quieter and nicer, just 5 minutes away, but this one is less isolated. You can also sleep a little closer to town, in the square itself. It's a perfect stop for a swim in the river if weather allows.

title: (19119) Zorita de los Canes - 2 Calle del Castillo

Pay attention to the route proposed by the gps. To get there, go through the Camino de la Laguna at La Guardia then continue straight ahead #BOF

name: Camping Buendia
title: (16512) Camping Buendia
description: Small campsite, which has bungalows, space for meetings, showers, toilets and a washing machine, an area to load and unload water, vending machines ... beautiful setting near the town ... close to shops, bars, etc. .

title: (16512) Buendía - 4 Calle San Pedro
description:
Area marked as services for Motorhomes.
In reality it only has a parking lot, emptied of gray, although while we were emptying we saw what was coming out through a pipe directly onto the street again, an environmental negligence, and we stopped emptying. The filling of water goes with tokens that are requested at the campsite next door or at the town hall. needs a lot of improvement

title: (28530) Morata de Tajuña - 3 Plaza de Francisco González
title_short: (28530) Morata de Tajuña - 3 Plaza de Francisco González
description: Flat city parking and big mega. If you go to the bottom of the car park, you can go up to land on the grass. Hyper calm. No services but when, like us, we do not need it, it's great!

title_short: (28530) Morata de Tajuña - 34 Calle de José María Rodelgo

name: Parque Las Eras
title: (28514) Parque Las Eras
description: New free pitch, very large undivided pitches, with litter bins, benches, next to the municipal winery, landscaped and a few meters from the Goyeneche Palace. Nuevo Baztan is one of the most beautiful cities in Spain. There are good restaurants, supermarkets, a tourist office, an interpretation center, a park with games and picnic tables.

title: (16512) Buendía -
description: Level area near the marsh, the entrance track is in good condition, shady areas, near the road that leads to the pontoon trail. very quiet to sleep

description: Location for emptying black and gray water and filling with water.

title: (19100) Pastrana - 55-56 Carretera Tarancón

title: (16512) Buendía - CM-2000
description: Parking next to the Buendía reservoir dam. It has nothing, just some 4G. It is a large and quiet parking lot. The road next to it has very little traffic at night. The squares are leveled, and it is somewhat illuminated by the lampposts of the dam. The environment is full of garbage of all kinds.

title: (16512) Buendía -
description: Small place on the banks of the marsh. Without shade. Tranquility even on a Saturday morning. place of fishermen and navigators. After the municipal campsite

title: (16512) Buendía - Calle Isabela
description: Buendia swamp. Along the edge of the swamp. Bucolic place. There is no service. We were alone, no noise. There are different places to stop near the shore. There is fishing. Watch out!! They are dirt tracks with some deep ruts.

title: (16512) Buendía - 47 CM-2000
description: Zona donde poder acceder a playa y zona de pesca

title: (28813) Pozuelo del Rey - 17 Calle del Real
title_short: (28813) Pozuelo del Rey - 17 Calle del Real

title_short: (45800) Quintanar de la Orden - 8 Avenida Anselmo Madero
description: Free parking lot for spending the night surrounded by houses. Every Wednesday morning there's a street market in the parking lot (forbidden to park during this time). Also from 14th to 20th of August is forbidden to park.

title: (16512) Buendía - Calle Isabela
description: We preferred to sleep in town, because the parking lot was completely empty. It is totally forbidden to park in the pines under penalty of a fine. As we have already seen in other reviews, the area is a bit dirty with plastic and garbage.

title: (16535) Villalba del Rey -
description: Parking next to the Plaza de Todos de Villalba. Recommended Friday and Saturdays that are not summer. In the area they make large bottles on that date. On weekdays, work begins early and there is a passage of vehicles. the tranquility of holiday eves is wonderful. Views of the town and in the distance of the Buenfia reservoir.

title: (45850) La Villa de Don Fadrique - 33A Calle Gibraltar
title_short: (45850) La Villa de Don Fadrique - 33A Calle Gibraltar
description: Free public parking. Quiet zone. Directly opposite there is a free emptying and filling service. Children's play area and very close to bakery and supermarket. On Mondays there is a market right next door and there is a municipal scale for each wallet.

title: (45870) Lillo - Camino del Romeral a las Pueblas
title_short: (45870) Lillo - Camino del Romeral a las Pueblas

Recreational area with picnic tables, a very beautiful hermitage, animals in captivity (raptors, ...) and archaeological remains of an old town. Very easy access by a dirt track, on the outskirts of town.

title: (19162) Pioz - 1 Camino del Castillo

The castle is open to the public abroad, if you want to visit you must contact the town hall. There are no services of any kind, but there are containers, a gas station and a supermarket right next door.

description: Place to fill water. It has no tap, natural source. Can be filled with hose or jugs. It takes a while but fine.

title: (45830) Miguel Esteban - 2 CM-3162
description: Large car park of the hermitage of San Isidro with its church and its mills. Ideal place for wildlife lovers, on the other side of the road there is a lagoon with a great diversity of birds, very close to El Toboso de Dulcinea land, a nearby villa provides free water
